gameLogic
Class gameLogic

java.lang.Object
  gameLogic.gameLogic

public class gameLogic
extends java.lang.Object

Class that implements the core tetris-logic. updateGame updates the current game-situation i.e. drops moving block down by one, removes full rows etc. getGameStatus returns int[][]-table with current game for graphics. movePiece moves or rotates currently moving block. Implementing getGameStatus, updateGame and rotate are the minimum to make a functioning tetris-game with graphics.

Method Detail

updateGame

public int updateGame()
Method for updating game-status, usually bringing block down for one row, returns an int which tells how many rows were removed (0 is none), -1 is returned if game is lost

Returns:
0 or bigger tells how many rows were eliminated, -1 tells game over

getGameStatus

public int[][] getGameStatus()
Gets this gameLogic-objects game status table.

Returns:
int[][]-table which has the current game, 0's are empty squares, 1's are solid blocks and 2's are currently moving blocks

getBlockXco

public int getBlockXco()
Gets this gameLogic-objects BlockXco

Returns:
the x-coordinate of current moving blocks upper left corner

getBlockYco

public int getBlockYco()
Gets this gameLogic-objects BlockYco

Returns:
the y-coordinate of current moving blocks upper left corner

getCurrentBlockType

public int getCurrentBlockType()
Gets this gameLogic-objects currentBlocks blocktype

Returns:
returns the type of block

public void movePiece(int move)
Method to rotate or move pieces, 0 rotates piece, 1 moves piece left, 2 moves piece right

Parameters:
move - 0 to rotate piece, 1 to move piece left, and 2 to move piece right
